text: well you know we made a we made a
bargain with mushara way back in 2001
where we actually we were holding all
the chips and he was a lot weaker but we
made a very bad bargain we basically
gave away everything to him and we got
very little in return uh the contribu
the the Pakistan military has helped
with the fight against terrorism but not
wholeheartedly and it's actually quite
uncooperative when it comes to
Afghanistan in fact the Taliban would
not be possible Taliban surge would not
have been possible without very explicit
Pakistani support for it for very for
strategic reasons Pakistan has its own
interests in Afghanistan which are not
the same as ours we try to constantly uh
focus on this security relationship
arguing that we need the Pakistan
military and we cannot get the Pakistan
military to 100% support us but we can
get them to support us 40% 50% and
that's better than 0% and we gave
Pakistan $150 million a year for the
level of support we got we get a
military
hardware we uh elevated them to status
of a close Ally in the war on terror and
the result is not necessarily
satisfactory parts of Northwest Frontier
Pakistan are now ruled by militants the
Pakistan military is not doing uh much
in terms of gaining offensive against
them but the big problem that that we we
the big mistake we made is that
politically we should have not given
away the house to
mashar we're giving you money for the
security
fight but politically we should have
said that we will not tolerate that you
destroy political institutions in in
Pakistan that you take the leading
politicians and send them to Exile and
then rip their parties apart we will not
tolerate you changing the Constitution
we will not tolerate you gerrymandering
the political process and uh you know it
it is only when he took the ultimate
step and the pakistanis stood up to him
that we finally said well you know he's
breaking the law we could have very
easily from the beginning uh been much
more resistant to calling him a moderate
pro-democracy
voice and giving him a green light to
essentially destroy the very
institutions that we want to create on
the Palestinian territories or in Egypt
we're giving millions of dollars to the
Arab world to try to create minimal
political structures secular political
structures that existed in Pakistan and
he's been destroying them and I think we
could have had a more balanced
relationship the fact that we uh didn't
structure our relationship with Pakistan
very clearly got us to where we are and
the second mistake we made is that we
personalized and we always do this this
relationship our relationship should be
with the military in Pakistan not with
General mush
